Understanding the different types of cloud services: IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.
Learning cloud computing infrastructure, including virtual machines, containers, and serverless computing.
Understanding the benefits and drawbacks of public, private, and hybrid clouds.
Familiarizing with cloud security, including data protection, encryption, and access control.
Learning cloud storage options, including block, file, and object storage.
Understanding cloud networking, including virtual private clouds, VPNs, and load balancing.
Learning about cloud monitoring and management tools, including automation and orchestration.
Familiarizing with cloud compliance and regulations, such as GDPR and HIPAA.
Understanding cloud migration strategies, including lift and shift, re-platforming, and refactoring.
Learning about cloud-native architecture and microservices.
Understanding cloud resilience and disaster recovery, including backup and failover.
Familiarizing with cloud cost management, including billing, optimization, and forecasting.
Learning about cloud data analytics, including data warehousing and big data processing.
Understanding cloud AI and machine learning tools and services.
Familiarizing with cloud DevOps practices, including continuous integration and deployment.
Learning about cloud APIs and integration platforms.
Understanding cloud performance optimization, including scaling and caching.
Familiarizing with cloud governance, including policies and compliance.
Learning about cloud identity and access management, including single sign-on and multi-factor authentication.
Understanding cloud vendor management, including SLAs and contracts.
Familiarizing with cloud architecture patterns, including event-driven and serverless architectures.
Learning about cloud collaboration and communication tools, including chatbots and video conferencing.
Understanding cloud mobile development, including mobile backend as a service (MBaaS).
Familiarizing with cloud gaming, including gaming as a service (GaaS).
Learning about cloud blockchain, including smart contracts and decentralized applications (dApps).
